lexUnit.name: sliver.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a small, narrow, sharp piece cut or split off a larger piece

sentence.text: One day we were poking around in some sodden ashes by the rear exit and found a few slivers of celluloid with images on them .
Serve with slivers of warm pitta bread .
With a sharp knife , make a number of deep incisions in the lamb and insert a sliver of garlic into each one .
The terranes are of several types and include slivers of oceanic crust , fragments of intra-oceanic island arcs and slices detached from unknown continental margins .
Yeremi , Tundrish , and Akbar shot down others who had survived the crystal slivers and the death cloud but who had slowed in apparent shock .
Jagged slivers of wood pointed outwards from the heavy brass plate at the top like a crown of thorns .
Digital watches work because a small sliver of quartz inside them pulses at a rhythmic and unchanging frequency , which is stimulated by energy from the battery .
Whole circuits are reduced to small slivers of material , measuring a few millimetres across , and the number of components and whole circuits that can be put on each chip is increasing each year .
Bergson smiled and slipped the thin sliver of ice into his jacket pocket , then stood up again .
Maureen took hers with a thin sliver of lemon , and delicately helped herself to a square of fudge .
She shows me the marrow , which looks like thick dark blood , and the tiny sliver of bone she has removed .
Returning , he set the two large pieces of the broken bowl to one side then began to sweep the tiny slivers of porcelain into a pile .
Razor-sharp slivers of glass punctured her hands and knees , drawing blood , but she did n't stop to pull them out .
He smashed the windscreen with one bullet and Adam felt a sliver of glass cut into his cheek , but he did little other damage .
As she stepped , slivers of glass cracked and crunched beneath her feet .
There were slivers of glass sparkling up at them from among the brambles .
The wipers kept knocking slivers of the ice off the windscreen .
A cold sliver of ice slid up her spine .
Lorton pulled the paint-scraper along the window-sill ; the blade bit too deeply , and he gouged out a sliver of wood .
He belched loudly when the account was finished and picked at his teeth with a sliver of wood .
She bent over Rob 's hand and slowly , deftly drew out the sliver of wood .
Almost certainly one or two scars had had a little extra sliver of wood removed .
